intro: Stachytarpheta radlkoferiana var. lanata, commonly known as the hairy stachytarpheta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive textured appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, two-lipped, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to blue, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for warm climates. Its ornamental value and adaptability make it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping in suitable environments.
